Sentencas: In recent years, energy carriers for renewable sources and devices that convert chemical energy into electrical energy, such as solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs), have made hydrogen production economically viable and have numerous industrial uses.
Titulo: An innovative perovskite oxide enabling improved efficiency for low-temperature ceramic electrochemical cells

Sentencas: We have designed SrFe0.3TiO3 (SFT) materials to function as SOFC and H-SOEC electrolytes at low operational temperatures of 520-420 degrees C.
Titulo: An innovative perovskite oxide enabling improved efficiency for low-temperature ceramic electrochemical cells

Sentencas: The SFT (600 degrees C) shows a higher fuel cell power density of 650 mW/cm2 and a reasonable current density of 1.14 A/cm2 in fuel cell and electrolysis cell mode at 520 degrees C.
Titulo: An innovative perovskite oxide enabling improved efficiency for low-temperature ceramic electrochemical cells

Sentencas: The formation of the surface layer enables high ionic and Proton conduction due to a high number of oxygen vacancies, and the core-shell type interface enables easy and quick proton transportation restricted to the surface.
Titulo: An innovative perovskite oxide enabling improved efficiency for low-temperature ceramic electrochemical cells

Sentencas: Energy band alignment and distribution relaxation time (DRT) were also evaluated to study ion transport in SFT materials.
Titulo: An innovative perovskite oxide enabling improved efficiency for low-temperature ceramic electrochemical cells

Sentencas: These results open up advanced avenues for the design of high-performance, sophisticated proton-conducting electrolytes for ceramic electrochemical cells.
Titulo: An innovative perovskite oxide enabling improved efficiency for low-temperature ceramic electrochemical cells
